required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Communities Fighting COVID Return to School
clinical_study.official_title: Communities Fighting COVID!: Returning Our Kids Back to School Safely

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: San Diego State University (SDSU), a designated Hispanic-serving institution, is partnering with Sweetwater Union High School District, an independent public school district serving 90% ethnic minority and a high proportion of socioeconomically disadvantaged students, and other community partners, to generate evidence for effective and feasible COVID-19 testing for unvaccinated and medically vulnerable middle school students and staff as part of broader COVID mitigation strategies including vaccination to return students back to school safely.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through trial completion, expected to be approximately 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of students and staff who participate in testing per the testing schedule (e.g., weekly testing)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through trial completion, expected to be approximately 5 months

arm_group.description: At-home COVID-19 testing model with active encouragement of household member participation in regular COVID-19 testing part way through the trial
On-site COVID-19 testing model with active encouragement of household member participation in regular COVID-19 testing part way through the trial
On-site COVID-19 testing model, no active encouragement of household member participation in COVID-19 testing

intervention.description: At-home over-the-counter (OTC) COVID-19 testing kits provided to middle school students and staff
Making the COVID-19 testing program available to household/family members to increase participation of students and staff in the school COVID-19 testing program
Onsite COVID-19 testing for middle school students and staff

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 2 years of age or older; student at a Sweetwater Union High School District Middle School, staff at a Sweetwater Union High School District Middle School or household member of a student or staff affiliated with a Sweetwater Union High School District Middle School
Exclusion Criteria:
- <2 years of age
- No affiliation with a Sweetwater Union High School District Middle School

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared with the NIH RADx-UP Coordination and Data Collection Center (CDCC). The CDCC is charged by the NIH with making data funded by the RADx-UP initiative available to other researchers.
